missionProperties.missionInfo:
{-} The door to the Safe is locked. A Rebel figure can attack the door to the Safe (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}) or interact with it ({J}) to open it.
{-} The Rebel mission token represents the data chip. A healthy Rebel figure can retrieve the data chip.
{-} The mission progresses when data chip is retrieved.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded and <color="red">Han Solo</color> is defeated.
missionProperties.repositionOverride: Block access to the data chip.

events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

After losing contact with Han Solo, you began scanning desperately, looking for any sign of the smuggler. The one clue you found was in Imperial channels: a landlock on Solo’s ship. You followed the leads further, eventually establishing contact with Solo.

Now you've finally reached a rendezvous in a dingy cantina in Mos Eisley, where he lays out a plan to retrieve Imperial docking codes and escape. “They should be closing down soon. Chewie tells me one of the guys who runs this place is a friendly and he’s got the codes I need to get that Imperial landlock taken off the Falcon. We get it, we get out. I don’t want to stick around this place any longer than I need to.”

The Imperials have different plans, however. Before you have the chance to execute this simple strategy, a large squad of troops bursts into the cantina from both sides, causing patrons to duck and run for the door. It seems you'll have to go with the less subtle approach.

eventActions.tbText:
{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Deploy <color="red">Han Solo</color> (Scoundrel) to the red highlighted space.
{-} The door to the Safe is locked. A Rebel figure can attack the door to the Safe (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}) or interact with it ({J}) to open it.
{-} The Rebel mission token represents the data chip. A healthy Rebel figure can retrieve the data chip.
{-} The mission progresses when data chip is retrieved.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded and <color="red">Han Solo</color> is defeated.

events.eventText:
Amidst a barrage of fire from the surrounding stormtroopers, you hastily upload the stolen docking codes into the terminal. You run forward with Han and provide covering fire as he jumps into the Falcon and blasts off the desolate planet’s surface. Not long after, he reaches you on your comlink.

“Good to be out of that slime pit. Thanks for all your help. Let me know if I can ever return the favor.”

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Heroes receive <color="red">Han Solo</color> (Scoundrel) as an ally.

eventActions.mainText: Did you play this mission as part of the "Twin Shadows" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
Blaster fire surrounds you as a trooper tackles you, shattering the data chip. The docking codes are lost. You are forced to break into a retreat during which you and Solo get separated. Later, you hear from him on your comlink: “Looks like I'll have to keep laying low for a while. This planet just seems to be more trouble than it’s worth.”

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.

eventActions.mainText: Did you play this mission as part of the "Twin Shadows" mini campaign?

events.eventText:
“Thanks again for your help back there,” you hear Solo say through your comlink. “Listen, with all that heat I had to get out faster than I liked, and I left a couple droids at a makeshift base. I'll send you the coordinates. Maybe they can be useful; they've been investigating the Imperial presence on the planet. I should be touching back down farther away from Mos Eisley soon. Let me know if you need any help and I should be able to sneak my way back in.”

You reach the coordinates on the outskirts of Mos Eisley. The base isn’t much, but it has a couple computers and a bed. There is also a small, blue astromech that you recognize as the droid who flew with Luke Skywalker, R2-D2. As soon as you enter, he starts rocking back and forth excitedly and beeping and whirring. You can't understand him, but soon he shows you a hologram.

The recording shows a small Imperial outpost in the back alleys of Mos Eisley and a gold protocol droid being blasted down by a stromtrooper. The R2 unit beeps and rocks even more excitedly as the recording finishes. It seems clear what your next destination is.

{-} Each hero receives 2 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.
{-} The next active mission is “Past Life Enemies”.

“No time to lick our wounds, guys,” your pilot says as he comes in on your comlink. “It seems there is a serious Imperial presence here in the form of an orbiting Star Destroyer. That must be what Solo was investigating. I’ve been trying to figure something out, but its readings are complex and hard to read with just this shuttle.”

“One thing seems to be for sure, though: it’s here with a planetary operation. I'll keep working up here, but I bet there’s plenty of info for you to find on the ground.”

“By the way, it seems Solo was here with some droids; I picked up a signal from an astromech called R2-D2. Maybe he can be of help in finding something out about what’s going on around here.”

{-} Each hero receives 2 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 300 credits per hero.
{-} The Empire receives <color="red">Boba Fett (Infamous Bounty Hunter)</color> as a villain.
{-} The next active mission is “Shady Dealings”.

{-} Each hero receives 1 XP.
{-} Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

events.eventName: End of Mission - Rebels lose Round
events.eventText:
Blaster fire surrounds you as a trooper tackles you, shattering the data chip. The docking codes are lost. You are forced to break into a retreat during which you and Solo get separated. Later, you hear from him on your comlink: “Looks like I'll have to keep laying low for a while. This planet just seems to be more trouble than it’s worth.”

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.

eventActions.mainText: Did you play this mission as part of the "Twin Shadows" mini campaign?

events.eventText: You hear the explosive roar of a jetpack as a bounty hunter bursts into view. The intimidating Boba Fett has joined the battle. Whether he was hired by the Imperials or came simply to collect Han’s bounty you're not sure, but you know that whatever the reason, his presence is a very unwelcome complication.
You open the door to reveal the Docking Bay. The Falcon is sitting silently. At the side of the hangar, a door burts open and enemies rush in.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The Door leads to the Docking Bay.

events.eventText: The door finally slips open to reveal a large safe. The data chip with the access codes lies in one of the shelves.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
A sturdy door protects a large safe.

{-} The door to the Safe is locked. A Rebel figure can attack the door to the Safe (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}) or interact with it ({J}) to open it.

The data chip with the docking codes sits on one of the shelves in the Safe.

{-} A healthy Rebel figure can retrieve the data chip.

events.eventText:
You hastily grab the data chip. Now all that is left to do is upload the docking codes in the Docking Bay. Easier said than done.

{-} While carrying the data chip, a hero or <color="red">Han Solo</color> can interact with the terminal in the Docking Bay ({I}) to upload the docking codes.
{-} The Rebels win when the docking codes are uploaded.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded and <color="red">Han Solo</color> is defeated.

eventActions.theText:
{-} While carrying the data chip, a hero or <color="red">Han Solo</color> can interact with the terminal in the Docking Bay ({I}) to upload the docking codes.
{-} The Rebels win when the docking codes are uploaded.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded and <color="red">Han Solo</color> is defeated.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The data chip with the docking codes sits on one of the shelves in the Safe.

eventActions.otherTarget: the Rebel carrying the data chip

eventActions.repositionText: Block access to the Docking Bay and the terminal.

eventActions.mainText:
You start to try and find the combination for the door.

{-} Test {J}. Apply +1 {B} for each strain token on the door, then discard all strain tokens on the door. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
You make some progress, but you haven't figured out the combination yet.

{-} For each {B} result, place 1 strain token on the door.

{-} The door to the Safe is locked. A Rebel figure can attack the door to the Safe (Health: 8, Defense: 1 {G}) or interact with it ({J}) to open it.
The Door leads to the Docking Bay.
The data chip with the docking codes sits on one of the shelves in the Safe.

The terminal controls the docking clamps.
